constraints.meeting_title: Literacy Coaching Check-in with Grant High Team

preferences.location_preference: Video call (Zoom) so teachers can join from home

target_selector.meeting_title: Literacy Coaching Check-in with Grant High Team

success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant finds an available late-afternoon or early-evening slot on or near 2026-01-15 and updates the existing coaching check-in meeting via update_meeting, preserving all attendees and switching to a Zoom link if needed.

task.objective: Reschedule the literacy coaching check-in with the Grant High School team to a later date that better fits teachers' after-school availability

injected_behaviors.instructions: The user, Maya, just learned that a district-wide literacy professional development session was moved onto the same afternoon as her Grant High School coaching check-in. She wants to keep the same group of attendees but move the meeting later in the week, ideally Thursday early evening so teachers can attend after classes. She is comfortable with either in-person at Grant High or a Zoom meeting, but would slightly prefer Zoom to make it easier for teachers with long commutes. She may reference her teaching schedule at the university (evening Educational Psychology seminar on Wednesdays) and needs to avoid overlapping with that course.

existing_meeting.title: Literacy Coaching Check-in with Grant High Team
existing_meeting.location: Grant High School, Literacy Resource Room 214

available_slots.location_suggestion: Grant High School, Literacy Resource Room 214

persona.name: Maya Ellison
persona.occupation: Literacy Specialist and Adjunct Lecturer in Educational Psychology
persona.bio: Maya Ellison is a literacy specialist in the Portland public school system and teaches a night course on the psychology of reading at a local university. She’s endlessly fascinated by how people make meaning from text, from early decoding to nuanced literary interpretation, and she keeps a notebook of favorite lines from every book she finishes. On weekends, you’ll usually find her at small poetry readings, annotating a dog‑eared collection, or drafting reflective essays about how language shapes the way we think.
persona.writing_style: warm, articulate, reflective, conversational but grammatically polished, often references books or concepts briefly
sample_messages: Could you help me pull a few recent articles on eye-tracking studies in reading comprehension? I’m revising my lecture for next Tuesday and want to give the students something more current than last year’s set.

I just finished the novel you recommended and I’m still thinking about that last chapter—especially the way the narrator’s voice shifts. Can we grab coffee sometime this week so I can return it (and probably leave with three more)?
Yes, that time works for me. If you send the draft over beforehand, I’m happy to leave comments on clarity and tone so we can talk through them during the meeting.

messages.output_raw: I need to reschedule a meeting—my literacy coaching check-in with the Grant High School team. The district just moved a PD onto the same afternoon, so I need to push our meeting later that week.

<action type="say">
Got it—you need to move that coaching check-in later in the same week.

To find and reschedule the exact event, I need a few details:
1) What day and time is the meeting currently scheduled for, and what time zone are you in?
2) Roughly which week is this (or the exact date)?
3) Who’s on the Grant High School team for this meeting (their email addresses, if you have them)?
4) For “later that week,” what windows work for you and the team (e.g., Thu–Fri, 2:00–4:30 pm), and how long is the meeting (e.g., 30 or 60 minutes)?
5) Is this a recurring meeting or a one-time event?

Once I have this, I’ll locate the event, check everyone’s availability later that week, and propose a couple of concrete new slots for you to choose from.</action>

action_structured.text:

To find and reschedule the exact event, I need a few details:
1) What day and time is the meeting currently scheduled for, and what time zone are you in?

3) Who’s on the Grant High School team for this meeting (their email addresses, if you have them)?

5) Is this a recurring meeting or a one-time event?

Once I have this, I’ll locate the event, check everyone’s availability later that week, and propose a couple of concrete new slots for you to choose from.

messages.output_raw:
Sure, here’s what I know and what I’m hoping for:

1) It’s currently scheduled mid–afternoon in my time zone (Pacific / America–Los_Angeles); the conflict is that a district-wide literacy PD was moved onto that same afternoon.  
2) The meeting is set for Tuesday, January 13, 2026.  
3) It’s the existing Grant High School literacy coaching team—same attendees as the current invite (please keep the group as is).  
4) I’d like to move it later that same week, ideally Thursday early evening after classes. A good window would be between 3:00 pm and 7:00 pm PT. The meeting is 60 minutes.  
5) This one is a single check-in, not part of a recurring series.

Two more constraints that matter:
- I teach an Evening Educational Psychology Seminar on Wednesdays, so please avoid overlapping with that.
- I also need to avoid any overlap with the District-wide Literacy PD.

If it’s an option, I’d slightly prefer to switch the location to a Zoom/video call so teachers can join from home, but in-person at Grant High is okay if that’s simpler.
